intro: Dampiera cunninghamii, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, daisy-like white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in full sun and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native gardens.
